intro: Chienodoxa tetradonta, commonly known as the four-toothed glorybower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces four stamens, which are distinctly visible and contribute to its common name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Chienodoxa tetradonta is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
